title: Specialty Court Program Act Amendments
administering_body: Arkansas Supreme Court / Administrative Office of the Courts

key_provisions.approval_requirement: Specialty court programs must be approved by Arkansas Supreme Court in administrative plan under Admin Orders 14 and 18
key_provisions.fee_authority: Court may not assess $250 specialty court user fee if program not approved or no longer meets approval criteria
key_provisions.user_fee_destination: State Treasury, credited to Specialty Court Program Fund
key_provisions.aoc_contracting_authority: AOC Director may contract for qualified attorneys as specialty-court team members
key_provisions.carryforward: Unspent AOC appropriations may be retained and distributed as supplemental funding for specialty court support/administration and restorative/rehabilitative services
key_provisions.formula_funding: AOC oversees disbursement based on formula developed by AOC, reviewed by SCPAC, approved by Arkansas Legislative Council

decision_authorities.fund_distribution: AOC (formula-based, SCPAC review, Legislative Council approval)

effects: Establishes approval-based gating for specialty court funding; ties fee collection to Supreme Court approval; authorizes AOC contracting and carryforward; requires formula-based distribution with multi-body oversight
